intro: Alloplectus multiflorus, commonly known as the many-flowered burrweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces distinctive, spiny fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Alloplectus multiflorus is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus.
